com.bergerkiller.bukkit.common.utils

Class LogicUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.bergerkiller.bukkit.common.utils.LogicUtil

  • public class LogicUtil
extends java.lang.Object
    Logic operations, such as contains checks and collection-type transformations

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static interface  LogicUtil.ItemSynchronizer<V,E>
      Synchronizes the items from one type to another, handling comparison, adding, and removal

                                  T... values)
        Appends one or more elements to an array This method allocates a new Array of the same type as the old array, with the size of array + values.
        Parameters:

        values - to append to array
        Returns:

      • cloneArray

        public static <T> T[] cloneArray(T[] array)
        Allocates a new array of the same length and writes the contents to this new array. Unlike cloneAll(Object[]), this method does not individually clone the elements
        Parameters:
        array - to re-allocate as a new array
        Returns:
        new array with the contents of the input array

        public static java.lang.Class<?> getArrayType(java.lang.Class<?> componentType)

        - int.class -> int[].class
        Parameters:
        componentType - to convert
        Returns:
        array type

      • getArrayType

        public static java.lang.Class<?> getArrayType(java.lang.Class<?> componentType,
                                              int levels)
        Obtains the Class instance representing an array of the component type specified. For example:
        - Integer.class -> Integer[].class
        - int.class -> int[].class
        Parameters:
        componentType - to convert
        levels - the amount of levels to create the array (e.g. 2=[][])
        Returns:
        array type

        index - of the element to get

      • skipIterator

        public static <T extends java.util.Iterator<?>> T skipIterator(T iterator,
                                                               int count)
        Skips elements from an iterator by calling 'next' a given amount of times (if possible). If the count exceeds the amount of elements the iterator provides, further elements are ignored. In that case, calling Iterator.hasNext() would yield false.
        Parameters:
        iterator - to skip
        count - to skip
        Returns:
        the iterator

      • getKeyAtValue

        public static <K,V> K getKeyAtValue(java.util.Map<K,V> map,
                                    V value)
        Obtains the key at which a specific value is mapped to in a Map. This is essentially the reverse key lookup in a map, and is thus slow. For 'BiMap' maps, the inverse is used to obtain the key faster.
        Parameters:
        map - to check
        value - to look for
        Returns:
        key the value is mapped to, or null if not found

      • getTypes

        public static java.lang.Class<?>[] getTypes(java.lang.Object[] values)
        Gets all the Class types of the objects in an array
        Parameters:
        values - input object array
        Returns:
        class types

      • synchronizeList

        public static <V,E> boolean synchronizeList(java.util.List<E> list,
                                            java.util.Collection<V> values,
                                            LogicUtil.ItemSynchronizer<V,E> synchronizer)
        Synchronizes the contents of a list by taking over the items in a collection of values. The items will be inserted into the list in the same order as the collection.
        Parameters:
        list - to synchronize
        values - to synchronize in the list
        synchronizer - to use when synchronizing the collection with the list
        Returns:
        True if the synchronized list changed, False if not
